intro: Symplocos bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain elder, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of mountainous regions, preferring rich, well-drained soil. Its fruits are small berries that mature to a reddish color, attracting various wildlife species. Symplocos bulusanensis plays a vital role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
